DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Progression Indeterminate Finding Basis Report Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind report used as the basis for a finding of indeterminate progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Progression Indeterminate Finding Basis Report
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm._Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something._A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a cancer over time.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98)

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.
